body.bibl: Origen. “Origen’s Commentary on the Gospel of John.” In The Gospel of Peter, The Diatessaron of Tatian, The Apocalypse of Peter, The Visio Pauli, The Apocalypses of the Virgin and Sedrach, The Testament of Abrtaham, The Acts of Xanthippe and Polyxena, The Narrative of Zosimus, The Apology of Aristides, The Epistles of Clement (Complete Text), Origen’s Commentary on John, Books I-X, and Commentary on Matthew, Books I, II, and X-XIV, translated by Allan Menzies, 5th ed., 9:297–408. The Ante-Nicene Fathers : Translations of the Writings of the Fathers down to A.D. 325. Original Supplement to the American Edition. New York: Charles Scribner’s Sons, 1926. https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=njp.32101075295970&view=1up&seq=7.

Origen, Origen’s Commentary on the Gospel of John, in The Gospel of Peter, The Diatessaron of Tatian, The Apocalypse of Peter, The Visio Pauli, The Apocalypses of the Virgin and Sedrach, The Testament of Abrtaham, The Acts of Xanthippe and Polyxena, The Narrative of Zosimus, The Apology of Aristides, The Epistles of Clement (Complete Text), Origen’s Commentary on John, Books I-X, and Commentary on Matthew, Books I, II, and X-XIV, trans. Allan Menzies, 5th ed., vol. 9, 10 vols., The Ante-Nicene Fathers : Translations of the Writings of the Fathers down to A.D. 325. Original Supplement to the American Edition (New York: Charles Scribner’s Sons, 1926), 297–408, https://babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=njp.32101075295970&view=1up&seq=7.
